posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
Greetings mortals!

I'm trying to set up a new build that is not necessarily the optimized build, but fits my playing style and preferences, also considering I play on Blackstone, where you can get +12 CON, +12 STR, +10 Damage resistance against averything and weapons with +20AB/+10EB and a shitload of damages. What I would wish for is that you guys take a look and point out any obvious mistakes (that are not a matter of taste). Please?

I've probably messed up the feats and one might discuss the weapon of choice, but Twin Katanas are so cool. (The best loot-weapon you can find on Blackstone is a Battleaxe with +2d10 Magical and +2d10 somethingelse, but it gets boring lugging around battleaxes on all your toons after a while....) I'm going to lug around a shield for low-level survivability and also for those extra +9AC that is useful on mid-high level. The high-level bosses is gonna hit me regardless, so that's where DPS comes in.

When it comes to skills, I need Discipline, UMD (for the wands that my Cleric makes me) and Tumble, but I want Lore/Heal/Search/Spot for playability (makes certain quests easier), that's why I waste 16 on INT instead of going for +1AB.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Hi Cornflower
Your build looks strong. 
Con 10 looks perhaps a bit weak, but since you can max it out with items, that helps a lot.
I don't know if Fighter 15 gives you anything specific on Blackstone keep. Normally it doesn't. If you go Fighter 14/Rogue 4 instead of Fighter15/ Rogue 3 and takes Rogue on character level 1, you will gain 24 skill points, more than half way to be able to start out with Int 14 and still keep your skills. It will not affect BAB or AB since you already have a rogue level pre epic.
Discipline, Intimidate, Spellcraft and Tumble are as they should ( take 18 x-classed ranks in Spellcraft if you try Int 14)
You can save one! skill point on UMD and end it on 41 (40). 
So it boils down to how many ranks you want - or need - in Heal, Lore, Search and Spot. 

As for feats, the build is feat-starved even with 14 or 15 fighter levels, and you still have room for Armor skin in your build. You can solve that by dropping the exotic WP ( I know the dual Katanas look cool and everything, but even so...)

Pre epic I like to take Expertise before Mobility, and Weapon Specialization and Blind fight before Great Cleave. Much is dictated by the feats you need to qualify for Weapon master. But you don't necessarily need to take WM asap. That let you wait a bit with feats like Spring attack and WWA and adds some freedom when deciding when to take the different feats. 
As for Epic feats, your strength dictates when you can take Dev crit. I would add AS as a WM bonus feat. I would take EWF on the general feat at lvl 21( freed up from not going with WP Exotic), and I would give it some thought if I should take EWS before EP. It depends on what use +1 AB is compared with +4 damage in a WM build in a high magic PW.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Cornflower wrote:The high-level bosses is gonna hit me regardless, so that's where DPS comes in.
Cornflower
Do you know how dexterity builds fare at BSK?
I ask because they have better defence than strength builds, with a high dex based AC, access to Epic Dodge, and the Self concealment feats.
In a high magic setting you can load a lot of damage bonus on a simple dagger or any other finesse weapon, so the strength based damage becomes less important.

Another question is how important is AB? I ask because in high magic settings the different AC sources often pile up to a total AC that makes it almost impossible to hit anything unless you roll a 20.

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
Well... Some thoughts from playing on BSK for years.

AC is not relevant in the high-end game unless you get somewhere around 75-85, since bosses are gonna hit you anyway. Basically, if you can win the war of attrition through high damage and some relevant Damage Resistance, AC is not something to focus on. AC is relevant up to the high-level bosses and some high-level critters. I recently got creamed in three hits despite AC 77 when I stuck my nose in the wrong place. (100 physical damage + various elemental damages per hit.)

AB is somewhat relevant since some high-end critters have high AC, but it's not that important with one or two points.

I have a dex-based AA that actually works rather well. In general dex-based builds work nicely, but even so, most people go for STR builds due to damage per second being more valuable than AC.

The latest fad right now is Fighter/Paladin/WM with three to five levels of Paladin just to get divine might and access to HA that will cut through boss resistances. Also various DD builds with high DR are fashionable.

Basically, that's the bad things about BSK, you can't win against the high-end bosses unless you have a team with the perfect set-up of powerbuilds. It's very frustrating for me, since most other people are playing when I'm asleep, so I mostly solo, which gets me nowhere. So, what I'm trying to do is find builds that work well up to a certain point, but most importantly are FUN to play. Hence the somewhat unorthodox skill set in this case.

Anyway, I think your comments and suggestions were very well thought out. I'll try to figure out what all the mysterious acronyms are and then apply it to my build. Thank you!

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content: Also, I really want to go Exotic, because if I go with more mundane choices, I could just as well go with the Fighter/Paladin/WM build with Bytor Battleaxes that everone else is using. Since I can't solo bosses or end quests regardless of build, I might as well go with "cool" and "fun" rather than optimize.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Unless your PW has a modified rule for dual katanas, dual-wielding katanas will hurt your AB because the off-hand weapon is too big.  To avoid a 2-point AB "penalty", a medium-sized character needs a small (or tiny) weapon off-hand, or a small character needs a tiny weapon off-hand.

posts.content:
Valerfor wrote: Cornflower, one question: What is the expected/maximum (realistically) enchantment bonus that you can have in your items apart from the weapons side?

I'm asking because I have heard both +10 & +6 from you & for defence, this plays a very important role.

Can you have +10 dodge/deflection/natural/armor/shield bonuses or is it +6 instead?

I also have heard that the Big Bads have 100AB, or is it lower actually & only one such Boss have that?

Give us as much info as you can.
Well.... Starting with bonuses (bonii?):

Typical weapons can have +20 AB, +10 EB, +5-1 EB depending on how good you are at crafting.
Most items you can find or craft have +6AC as maximum. There are some few exceptions, but with around 20 toons and several years of play I have only ever seen one of those (if you manage to open the secret portal, you can visit a rural area where there are very high-level Attack Chickens, yes..., where there's a 1 in 1000 that they will drop a +10AC armor. I've never managed to kill more than a handful of those chickens, also I have forgotten which items you need to open the portal, so I won't get my hands on that armor anytime soon).

You can craft items with 5% immunities (shield/helm) or 25% immunities (armor) against bludgeoning/piercing/slashing.
You can find items with 10 or 15 Damage reduction against various damages. Gloves with 15 Damage Resistance agasint slashing + piercing + bludgeoning comes to mind. Or a shield with 10 Damage Resistance against sonic+acid+electrical+fire.

You can add abilities to any objects, so if you find a good cloak of protections, you can add a Forge Stone to it and give it INT+6 (only trouble is that which ability bonus you get is random) or something. You can add various things like Haste, Regen, Freedom, Holy Avenger, Divine Damage, Knockdown immunity, etc, etc, etc if you're good enough at crafting (80+). In any case, you can almost always max out 2 or 3 abilities on your toon if you can afford it. My Bard/BG/RDD at level 37 has AB47/AC67 and STR 49/DEX 10/CON 28/INT 12/CHA28 due to good items.

There are variations of the big bads. Some have very high immunities, some score ridiculous damages, some have silly AB/AC. Those that I have most trouble with are those with really high AC and AB. There are several high-level critters with 80-85 AB or 80-85 AC. Occasional bosses have (or so I've heard) even higher. I'm not sure about 100 AB/AC, though. I've never gotten so close to those bosses that they left an imprint in my logs.... There are a couple of critters that have really bad damages, like: 100 physical damages + several d10 elemental damages / OnHit Harm / 100 magical damages per "look" (beholder mages).

In general the only successful builds that can solo high-end areas are various DwDefenders, some dex-based Fighter/Monk and possibly the occasional well-played Wizard. Right now the forums are down, otherwise I could have linked the popular builds.
